unnormalised: IIT Kanpur released a statement yesterday concerning a rather, shall we say, "interesting" outcome from their Stats 101 exam. Apparently, according to their calculations, 105% of the students think they deserve an A. Dr. Sharma, the professor in charge, was quoted as saying, "Either everyone's a genius, or someone needs a refresher course on probability... and maybe also humility."
normalised: I-I-T Kanpur released a statement yesterday concerning a rather, shall we say, "interesting" outcome from their Stats one hundred and one exam. Apparently, according to their calculations, one hundred and five percent of the students think they deserve an A. Doctor Sharma, the professor in charge, was quoted as saying, "Either everyone's a genius, or someone needs a refresher course on probability... and maybe also humility."

unnormalised: The university administration is now embroiled in a heated debate, trying to figure out whether to retroactively lower the difficulty level of the exam or declare the entire batch "statistically improbable geniuses." There’s even talk of sending the results to ISRO to see if they can use it to predict monsoon patterns, since clearly, conventional models have failed us.
normalised: The university administration is now embroiled in a heated debate, trying to figure out whether to retroactively lower the difficulty level of the exam or declare the entire batch "statistically improbable geniuses." There’s even talk of sending the results to I-S-R-O to see if they can use it to predict monsoon patterns, since clearly, conventional models have failed us.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, social media is having a field day. One student tweeted, "Finally, proof that hard work is a 105% guarantee of success! #IITLogic #StatsFail #Blessed." Another posted a meme of a confused mathematician with the caption, "Probability is a cruel mistress. Or maybe just needs chai."
normalised: Meanwhile, social media is having a field day. One student tweeted, "Finally, proof that hard work is a one hundred and five percent guarantee of success! hash I-I-T-Logic hash StatsFail hash Blessed." Another posted a meme of a confused mathematician with the caption, "Probability is a cruel mistress. Or maybe just needs chai."

unnormalised: The Dean of Academics, Prof. Kapoor, has promised a thorough investigation, stating that the university will leave no stone unturned, even if it means hiring a data scientist from Bollywood to find out "yeh result ki kahani kya hai." Until then, students are advised to enjoy their 105% assurance of passing, and maybe, just maybe, crack open a stats textbook.
normalised: The Dean of Academics, Professor Kapoor, has promised a thorough investigation, stating that the university will leave no stone unturned, even if it means hiring a data scientist from Bollywood to find out "yeh result ki kahani kya hai." Until then, students are advised to enjoy their one hundred and five percent assurance of passing, and maybe, just maybe, crack open a stats textbook.
